title: Differential Geometry and Information Manifolds
description: Differential geometric foundations of information geometry and its application to Active Inference.
learning_objectsives: Understand differential geometry in Active Inference
Work with Riemannian manifolds of probability distributions

content.overview: Differential geometry provides the mathematical foundation for understanding the geometric structure of probability distributions and their role in Active Inference. It enables rigorous analysis of information flow, natural gradients, and optimization on statistical manifolds.

manifolds_and_tangent_spaces.topological_manifolds: Spaces that locally look like Euclidean space
manifolds_and_tangent_spaces.tangent_spaces: Vector spaces attached to each point on manifold

riemannian_geometry.curvature: How manifold deviates from Euclidean space

connections_and_covariant_derivatives.parallel_transport: Move vectors along curves without changing them
connections_and_covariant_derivatives.geodesics: Curves of shortest length on manifold

curvature_tensors.riemann_curvature: R^i_jkl = ∂_k Γ^i_jl - ∂_l Γ^i_jk + Γ^i_mk Γ^m_jl - Γ^i_ml Γ^m_jk

interactive_exercises.task: Use natural gradients for efficient optimization

common_misconceptions.misconception: Differential geometry is only for physical space
common_misconceptions.clarification: Applies to abstract spaces like probability distributions
Curvature is a tensor with rich geometric information
